In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

In Julia you can define your function like this:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str, " ")
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = "$word"
        else
            current_line *= " $word"
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)  # Add the last line
    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```
The function `wrap_string` takes a string and an optional parameter specifying how wide each line should be. It splits the string into words, then iterates over these words. If adding the current word to the current line would exceed the specified width, it adds the current line to the list of lines and starts a new one with just the current word.

Here is an example:

```julia
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit"
println(wrap_string(str))
```
This will print:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit 
amet, consecte
tur adipisci
ng elit
```
